name: The Journey

name: Pan's Labyrinth

name: Rodnye (Close Relations)
pitch: Vitaly Mansky’s intimate and insightful new documentary finds him crisscrossing the Ukraine in the wake of the Maidan uprising, which has left his relatives scattered on both sides of a highly charged and dizzyingly complex political situation.

name: Sevince (When you love)

screenplay: Bavo Defurne, Yves Verbraeken, Jacques Boon
cast: Isabelle Huppert, Kévin Azaïs, Johan Leysen

producers: Trevor Davidoski, Jennifer Davisson, James Packer, Fisher Stevens, Leonardo DiCaprio, Brett Ratner
editors: Geoff Richman, Ben Sozanski, Brett Banks, Abhay Sofsky

name: The Untamed
countries: Mexico / Denmark / France / Germany / Norway / Switzerland
pitch: Cannes prize-winning director Amat Escalante (Heli) combines family drama and social commentary with science fiction and horror in this hypnotic and utterly enthralling tale, about an unhappily married couple whose life is turned upside down when they encounter a mysterious creature that is both a source of pleasure and a force of destruction.

sound: Sergio Diaz, Vincent Arnardi, Raúl Locatelli

pitch: A Syrian radio DJ documents the experiences of herself and her friends as their dreams of hope and liberation in the wake of the 2011 Arab Spring give way to the grim realities of repression, forced emigration and extremism.
cinematographers: Obaidah Zytoon, Amr Kheito, Hisham Issa, Wasim Zahra

name: The Wasted Times
pitch: Superstars Zhang Ziyi, Ge You, and Tadanobu Asano headline this hotly anticipated, stylistic thriller set in the Shanghai underworld of the 1930s.
producers: Zhang Dajun, T.K Yang, Lina Wu
cast: Zhang Ziyi, Ge You, Tadanobu Asano

name: The White Helmets
pitch: A small group of volunteer heroes, the White Helmets defy death, dodging bombs and sniper fire, to rescue Syrians from the bombs that fall incessantly on their towns and cities. However, after three years and with no end in sight, even the heroes may need to be saved.
production: Grain Media, Violet Films, Netflix, Inc.
cinematographers: Franklin Dow, Fadi Al Halabi, Hassan Kattan, Khaled Khateeb
cast: Mohammed Oais Aboud, Hussein Alassi, Mahmoud Mohammed Ali, Mahmoud Alloush “Abu Omar", Ismail Alloushe, Najib Bakour, Khalid Farah, Mohammed Farah, Abdul-Moeen Al Hamawia, Hikmat Hassanato, Yasser Sayyed Huseyin, Abdo Ibrahim "Abu Bashir", Mohammed El Ibrahim, Mohammed Sheikh Kaddour, Omar Kasas, Khaled Khateeb, Sofuan Khalaf "Abu Abdullah", Salah al Kossa, Hussein Mayouf, Mohammed Mayouf, Safwan Qassas, Raed Saleh, Nour Saleh, Mahmoud Al Satouf, Amma Mahmoud, "Miracle Baby" Mahmoud, Mohammed Qitaz “Abu Zaid”

name: Their Finest
pitch: Danish filmmaker Lone Scherfig (An Education, The Riot Club) directs a sterling British cast — including Gemma Arterton, Bill Nighy, Jack Huston and Richard E. Grant — in this period comedy-drama about a group of filmmakers struggling to make an inspirational film to boost morale during the Blitz of London in World War II.
producers: Stephen Woolley, Amanda Posey, Finola Dwyer, Elizabeth Karlsen
cast: Gemma Arterton, Sam Claflin, Bill Nighy, Jack Huston, Helen McCrory, Eddie Marsan, Jake Lacy, Rachel Stirling, Richard E. Grant

name: Things to Come
pitch: French writer-director Mia Hansen-Løve (Eden, Goodbye First Love) directs the great Isabelle Huppert in this delicate and affecting tale about a middle-aged professor whose carefully structured life is thrown into disarray when her husband leaves her for another woman, and who finds an unlikely new companion in a former student and radical young communist.
cast: Isabelle Huppert, André Marcon, Roman Kolinka, Edith Scob, Sarah Le Picard, Solal Forte

name: Those Who Make Revolution Halfway Only Dig Their Own Graves
pitch: Mathieu Denis (Corbo) and Simon Lavoie (Le torrent) evoke Godard’s La Chinoise with this stunning fusion of fiction and documentary about a radical Quebec leftist cell seeking to sow mayhem in Montreal as a prelude to overthrowing the government.
sound: François Grenon, Patrice LeBlanc, Clovis Gouaillier
cast: Charlotte Aubin, Laurent Bélanger, Emmanuelle Lussier-Martinez, Gabrielle Tremblay

name: TMG_103 (rough cut)
pitch: In this insightful behind-the-scenes examination of sexual politics on set, a director pressures an actress into full nudity on the morning of her first sex scene.
production: VIEW Entertainment Group, Walt Sidney Productions
cast: Sidney Leeder, Shaun Benson, Shannon Kook, Dean Armstrong

name: Toni Erdmann
pitch: One of the most talked-about films at this year’s Cannes, the new film from Maren Ade (The Forest for the Trees, Everyone Else) is an alternately hilarious and mortifying comedy about the fraught relationship between a repressed corporate consultant and her incessantly prank-playing dad.
producers: Janine Jacowski, Jonas Dornbach, Michel Merkit, Maren Ade
cast: Peter Simonischek, Sandra Hüller, Michael Wittenborn, Thomas Loibl, Trystan Pütter, Hadewych Minis, Lucy Russell, Ingrid Bisu, Vlad Ivanov, Victoria Cocias

name: Transition
pitch: Jana prepares to leave her family for a new life across the Atlantic. But her carefully crafted plans can’t cover up the secrets she has so expertly kept hidden from her family, and the façade is in danger of crumbling.
cast: Ivana Vukovic, Milica Trifunovic, Milica Stefanovic, Nikola Rakocevic, Anita Mancic, Boris Isakovic, Aleksandar Gligoric, Jasna Djuricic, Jovana Belovic

name: Trespass
pitch: A woman walking her dog alone in the forest finds company she didn’t expect and an enigma she can’t comprehend. Trespass is a thriller about the nature of sympathy... and the merits of keeping your pet on a leash.
cast: Maya Stange, Sara West

name: Trespass Against Us
pitch: The son and presumptive heir of a British criminal clan (Michael Fassbender) comes into conflict with the family patriarch (Brendan Gleeson) when he tries to break away from the outlaw life.
producers: Andrea Calderwood, Gail Egan, Alastair Siddons
cast: Michael Fassbender, Brendan Gleeson, Lyndsey Marshal, Killian Scott, Rory Kinnear, Sean Harris

name: Tshiuetin
pitch: A trip on an Indigenous-owned train line in northern Québec, shot in exquisite black and white, becomes an eloquent symbol of the pride and dignity that come with autonomy.

name: Twisted
pitch: In Thorold, Ontario, one night in the summer of 1996, a movie legend was made when a real-life tornado hit a drive-in theatre during a screening of Twister. But how much truth really lies inside this tale of life (or weather) imitating art? Jay Cheel’s quest for answers yields something surprising and delightful.
cast: John Mitterer, Sarah Laurin, Steve Taylor, Genevieve Jones, Anna Atamaniuk, Sonny Tutti, John Law, Hank Makkreel, Marie Makkreel

name: Two Lovers and a Bear
pitch: Montreal-born director Kim Nguyen's first fiction film following his Oscar-nominated Rebelle is a hypnotic romance about two star-crossed lovers (Tatiana Maslany and Dane DeHaan) who find that even the icy expanses of the Arctic offer little refuge from their pasts.
production: Max Films, JoBro Productions, North Creative
producers: Roger Frappier, Jonathan Bronfman, Ellen Hamilton
sound: Claude La Haye, Claude Beaugrand, Bernard Gariépy Strobl
cast: Dane DeHaan, Tatiana Maslany

name: Una
pitch: Rooney Mara (Carol) and Ben Mendelsohn (Mississippi Grind, Netflix’s Bloodline) star in this adaptation of David Harrower’s play Blackbird, about a young woman who arrives in the workplace of an older man from her past, seeking answers for the long-ago events that have fatefully shaped both of their lives.
producers: Maya Amsellem, Jean Doumanian, Patrick Daly
cast: Rooney Mara, Ben Mendelsohn, Riz Ahmed

name: Unless
pitch: Academy Award nominee Catherine Keener and Hannah Gross (I Used to Be Darker) star in this adaptation of the final novel by the late, great Canadian novelist Carol Shields, about a writer who discovers her runaway daughter panhandling on the street and seemingly deprived of speech.
producers: Jennifer Kawaja, Julia Sereny, Tristan Orpen Lynch, Aoife O'Sullivan
sound: Fionan Higgins, Stephen Marian, Robert Fletcher
cast: Catherine Keener, Matt Craven, Hannah Gross, Chloe Rose, Abigail Winter, Martha Henry, Brendan Coyle, Hanna Schygulla, Linda Kash, Benjamin Ayres

name: Untitled, 1925
pitch: Evincing formal echoes of Bruce Baillie, Madi Piller’s Untitled, 1925 is a personal, experimental travelogue that traces the voyage of Piller’s grandfather through the highlands of Peru.

name: Water and Sugar: Carlo Di Palma, the Colours of Life
pitch: A galaxy of cinema luminaries — from Ken Loach and Ettore Scola to Wim Wenders and Bernardo Bertolucci — pay tribute to the great Italian cinematographer Carlo di Palma, in this loving documentary that chronicles di Palma’s extraordinary work for such directors as Elio Petri, Michelangelo Antonioni, and Woody Allen.

name: We Can't Make the Same Mistake Twice
pitch: The new film from celebrated documentarian Alanis Obomsawin (Kanehsatake: 270 Years of Resistance) chronicles the events following the filing of a human-rights complaint by a group of activists, which charged that the federal government's woefully inadequate funding of services for Indigenous children constituted a discriminatory practice.

name: Weirdos
pitch: Canadian master Bruce McDonald (Hard Core Logo, The Tracey Fragments) teams with veteran playwright and screenwriter Daniel MacIvor for this offbeat coming-of-age comedy-drama, about two Nova Scotian teens who hit the road in July 1976 accompanied by the laconic ghost of (the still-living) Andy Warhol.
production: Lithium Studios Productions, Shadow Shows, Holdfast Pictures
cast: Dylan Authors, Julia Sarah Stone, Molly Parker, Allan Hawco

name: Werewolf
pitch: The hardscrabble existence of two homeless, twentysomething drug addicts is portrayed with sensitivity and brutal honesty in the debut feature by Ashley McKenzie.
cast: Andrew Gillis, Bhreagh MacNeil

name: Whispering Breeze
pitch: In this captivating ode to the beauty of childhood and the pain of exile, director Jonathan Tremblay combines black-and-white images of a coastal town with the imagined words of an elderly woman who longs to see her home once more.
cast: Mara Joly, Benoît Côté, Nicole DesRoches

name: Wild Skin
pitch: In this adaptation of a story by Quebec writer Fannie Loiselle, a solitary woman’s encounter with a baby python triggers a remarkable process of transformation and liberation. Fuelled by Marilyn Castonguay’s mesmerizing performance, Ariane Louis-Seize’s film is both sensual and surreal.
cast: Marilyn Castonguay, Alexis Lefebvre

name: Window Horses (The Poetic Persian Epiphany of Rosie Ming)
pitch: Sandra Oh, Ellen Page and Don McKellar lend their voices to this warm and witty animated feature by Ann Marie Fleming (The Magical Life of Long Tack Sam), about a young Canadian poet who undergoes a life-changing experience when she attends a poetry festival in Iran.
production: Stickgirl Productions Inc., National Film Board of Canada
producers: Ann Marie Fleming, Shirley Vercruysse, Michael Fukushima
editors: Ann Marie Fleming, Ileana Pietrobruno, Jean Denis Rouette
cast: Sandra Oh, Ellen Page, Shohreh Aghdashloo, Don McKellar, Omid Abtahi, Navid Neghaban, Nancy Kwan, Eddy Ko

name: WITHOUT NAME
pitch: A land surveyor discovers a dark secret deep within a dense forest, in this eco-horror thriller from first-time Irish filmmaker Lorcan Finnegan.
cast: Alan McKenna, Niamh Algar, James Browne

name: X Quinientos
pitch: Set in Mexico, Colombia and Canada, the second feature by Juan Andres Arango (La Playa DC) follows the stories of three unrelated migrants who each experience the death of a loved one, and must undergo both mental and physical transformations in order to deal with their grief and find a new place for themselves in the world.
producers: Yanick Letourneau, Jorge Botero, Edher Campos, Luis Salinas
sound: René Portillo, Isabel Torres, Daniel Garcia
cast: Jembie Almazan, Jonathan Diaz Angulo, Bernardo Garnica Cruz

name: Your Mother and I
pitch: Julia Sarah Stone (a TIFF 2014 Rising Star) and the one and only Don McKellar are in top form, playing a skeptical daughter and her impressively loquacious father, in Anna Maguire’s funny and poignant adaptation of a Dave Eggers story.
production: Paper Bag Productions, Low Sky Productions, Meraki Moving Pictures
producers: Kat Hidalgo, Peter Kuplowsky, Anna Maguire
cast: Don McKellar, Julia Sarah Stone

name: The Aviator's Wife
pitch: Falling prey to a classic Rohmerian misapprehension, a jealous law student and part-time postman sets out to track down the man he believes to be his romantic rival, taking a teenaged schoolgirl along as his sidekick in the hunt.

name: Parody and Mockumentary Filmmaking (Ages 11-14)
pitch: This camp is designed for youth who love make others laugh while lampooning popular film!

name: Minotaur
pitch: In Minotaur, an archetypal hero takes a journey through seven stages: birth, childhood, mission, labyrinth, monster, battle, and death/rebirth. Through purely abstract moving images, the corresponding emotional states are conveyed: calm, love, joy, surprise, fear, anger/hate, and death/rebirth, leading again to calm. Minotaur was created in Sandde, the world's first freehand stereoscopic 3D animation software, and adapted for 360°immersion.

name: SANKHARA
pitch: Inspired by T.S. Eliot's 'Four Quartets,' Sankhara begins at the end of an astronaut’s mission, as we follow him home through our awe-inspiring universe. Upon arrival back to Earth, he reflects upon his life choices, questions what might have been, and eventually finds solace in his decisions.

name: Suspicion
pitch: Joan Fontaine won the Best Actress Oscar as a shy young heiress who begins to suspect that her playboy husband (Cary Grant) is plotting to murder her.

name: Le Beau Mariage
pitch: Tired of acting as the bohemian mistress to a married painter, a young art student sets her matrimonial sights on a successful older lawyer, in Rohmer's mortifyingly hilarious comedy.

name: The Piano
pitch: Sold into marriage to a New Zealand settler, a mute woman (Holly Hunter) becomes involved in a strange game of sexual extortion with a "gone-native" frontiersman (Harvey Keitel), in Jane Campion's Oscar-winning fable of erotic awakening.

name: Food Fight
pitch:
Food Fight is a playful VR experience that allows users to take a stand against big food, while surrounded by angry chefs. There is no margarine for error, bring on the grapes of wrath. Apples serve as your core weapon — making disabling enemies apeeling. Food Fight combines action and strategy to create a real pizza work. Romaine calm in the face of udder chaos and gouda luck!
WORLD PREMIERE

name: The Music of Kurt Weill: September Songs preceded by Burnt Toast: The Argument
Soleil O
pitch: A masterpiece of modernist cinema, Med Hondo's first feature chronicles the travails of a West African-born accountant who arrives in Paris to pursue his dreams.

name: The Unknown Photographer
pitch: The Unknown Photographer is a documentary/fiction hybrid that takes participants on a journey through a virtual reality filled with the fragmented memories of a First World War photographer. This surrealistic stroll through a museum, set in a 3D universe featuring otherworldly structures, invites viewers to question the power of images and the ravages of war.
producers: National Film Board of Canada, Turbulent

name: Film FUN-damentals (Ages 8-10)
pitch: In this one week summer program campers will explore several facets of the filmmaking process.

name: Raising Cain
pitch: A respected child psychologist (John Lithgow) proves to have more than a few screws loose in De Palma's highly stylized, self-reflexive psychological thriller.

name: A Flood in Baath Country
pitch: Omir Amiralay uses a faultily constructed state-built dam as a potent metaphor for the corroding effects of four decades of Baathist rule over Syria.

name: Ma nuit chez Maud
pitch: A Catholic engineer (Jean-Louis Trintignant) has his resolve (and his faith) tested when he finds himself torn between a seemingly angelic blonde and a vivacious, dark-haired divorcee, in Eric Rohmer's international breakthrough.

name: En compagnie d'Éric Rohmer
pitch: Frequent Rohmer star Marie Rivière directs this documentary which shows the French master in conversation with collaborators and admirers including Arielle Dombasle, Fabrice Luchini, François Ozon and Valeria Bruni-Tedeschi, who offer their reminiscences and views on him as both a filmmaker and a friend.

name: Inverse Dollhouse
pitch:
Inverse Dollhouse simulates the tender analog experience of building an environment for a doll.
Viewers within the VR headset are cast as a doll, while others, using a tablet, build a domestic environment around them, their massive hands moving overhead.

name: Nature Abstraction
pitch: Nature Abstraction visualizes the enigmatic structure of fractals using natural and biological forms. Processed through Google’s Deepdream, the fractal landscapes morph into psychedelic patterns that viewers can explore.

name: Phantom Boy
pitch: An 11-year-old boy becomes an unlikely superhero when he discovers that he has the ability to leave his body and fly through walls, in this marvellously animated adventure from the creators of the Academy Award-nominated A Cat in Paris.
production: Folimage, Lunanime, France 3 Cinéma, Rhône-Alpes Cinéma
cast: Audrey Tautou, Édouard Baer, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Jackie Berroyer, Gaspard Gagnol

name: Eagle Flight
pitch: Eagle Flight takes place fifty years after humans vanished from the face of the Earth. Nature has reclaimed the city of Paris, leaving a breathtaking playground. As an eagle, you soar past iconic landmarks, dive through narrow streets, and engage in heart-pounding aerial dog fights to protect your territory from opponents.

name: Four Adventures of Reinette and Mirabelle
pitch: Rohmer returns to the improvisational spirit of his nouvelle vague days with this delightful variation on the country mouse/city mouse theme, which sends the naïve, moralistic and provincial Reinette and the worldly, jaded Parisian Mirabelle off on a quartet of exploits that steadily escalate in hilarity.

name: Through the Olive Trees
pitch: A young bricklayer uses his casting in a Kiarostami film as an opportunity to woo the young woman who has already turned down his proposal of marriage, in Kiarostami's bittersweet, self-reflexive mixture of farce and formalism.

name: Multiple Maniacs
pitch: Restored to its full revolting glory, John Waters' gloriously grotesque, unavailable-for-decades second feature comes to theatres at long last.

name: The Turning Forest
pitch: The Turning Forest is a sound based real-time CGI VR experience set in a place where things are not quite what they seem. Audiences are invited into a magical space of imagination, where rustling leaves are also the footsteps of something familiar, yet strange. Created by award-winning multimedia artist Oscar Raby.
producers: VRTOV with BBC R&D, S3A, Selley Silas

name: Step by Step
pitch: A frightening, captivating, and insightful portrait of how the Baath regime transformed generations of peasants into citizen-soldiers.

name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
pitch: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table gallop horselessly across the land to the thundering sound of coconut shells in the Pythons' majestically murky send-up of the Grail legend.
cast: Graham Chapman, John Cleese

name: Jules et Jim
pitch: François Truffaut's exuberant, sublimely romantic account of two best friends (Oskar Werner and Henri Serre) and their decades-long love triangle with the bewitching Catherine (Jeanne Moreau) is one of the most beloved classics of the French New Wave.

name: You Ain't Scene Nothing Yet (Ages 11-14)
pitch: This camp is suited for individuals interested in film roles both off and on camera.

name: The Bride Wore Black
pitch: A vengeful woman (Jeanne Moreau) hunts down the five men who caused her husband's accidental death, in François Truffaut's elegant homage to Hitchcock.

name: Notorious
pitch: A hard-drinking socialite (Ingrid Bergman) is recruited by a government agent (Cary Grant) to spy on a suspected Nazi (Claude Rains), in Alfred Hitchcock's scintillating suspense tale.

name: Safety Last!
pitch: Harold Lloyd dangles from a giant clock face in this hilarious and hair-raising silent-comedy classic.

name: Sonar
pitch: In Sonar, a drone discovers an unknown asteroid. On its journey over the rocky surface it receives a strange signal. Follow as the drone ventures deep into an ancient cave system to locate its source and discover the truth about the darkest of all places.

name: Burnt Toast: The Argument
pitch: A husband fantasizes a rebuttal to an argument he imagines having with his wife.

name: Small Change
pitch: François Truffaut used over 200 non-professional child actors to make this poetic comedy about the daily delights, passions and travails of schoolchildren in provincial France.

name: Film FUN-damentals and Animation (Ages 8-10)
pitch: In this two week programme campers will explore several facets of the filmmaking process.

name: Sequenced
pitch: Sequenced takes place in an animated, interactive world where there is only one city left on Earth. Recons are sent out to find lost populations in this virtual reality series in which characters and environments react to the user's presence.

name: Equals
pitch: Kristen Stewart and Nicholas Hoult star in the ambitious new film from director Drake Doremus (Like Crazy), about a utopian future society where crime and violence have been eradicated through the genetic elimination of human emotion, and where those afflicted with the emotional "disease" are forced to go on the run.
production: Scott Free Productions, Route One Entertainment
producers: Michael Schaefer, Michael Pruss, Ann Ruark, Chip Diggins, Jay Stern
cast: Kristen Stewart, Nicholas Hoult, Guy Pearce, Jacki Weaver

name: Way to Go
pitch: Way to Go is a walk in the woods. This award-winning interactive experience is a mixture of hand-made animation, 360° video capture, music and dreaming and code. Soundtrack by Philippe Lambert.
producers: National Film Board of Canada, France TV, AATOAA

name: My Girlfriend’s Boyfriend
pitch: Rohmer sets this minuet of romantic misunderstanding in a sterile, hyper-rationalized Parisian suburb whose pristine vistas recall Jacques Tati's classic PlayTime.

name: Video Game Design (Ages 8-10)
pitch: One of our most popular camps, Video Game Design Camp allows young gamers to engage with this field through hands on experience.

name: Love in the Afternoon
pitch: A family man and former roué finds himself irresistibly tempted by his friend's volatile and promiscuous ex-mistress, in Rohmer's pitch-perfect comedy of carnality.

name: Seances
pitch: Described as, among other things, an expressionistic recursive melodrama, Seances presents a new way of experiencing film narrative, framed through the lens of loss. In a technical feat of data-driven cinematic storytelling, films are dynamically assembled in never-to-be repeated configurations. Each exists only in the moment, offering the audience one chance to see this film before it disappears.

name: Cardboard Crash
pitch: Cardboard Crash asks who it is that determines the ethics algorithm to handle emergency situations in a world of AI and self-driving cars. In this VR vignette, the user is slowed down to bullet-time, becoming the computer, and is forced to confront a hard decision where there is plenty of data, but no easy answer.

name: L'Important c'est d'aimer
pitch: Romy Schneider gives a heart-rending performance in Andrzej Zulawski's brutal and beautiful masterpiece, about a B-movie actress who is drawn into a love triangle involving her sardonic cinephile husband (Jacques Dutronc) and a smitten smut photographer (spaghetti-western stud Fabio Testi).

name: West Indies: The Fugitive Slaves of Liberty
pitch: Med Hondo's stunning widescreen musical takes place on a single set — a giant slave ship that symbolizes the triangular relationship between Africa, Europe and the Caribbean — as it explores the parallels between the Atlantic slave trade and the contemporary migration of Afro-Caribbean subjects to former colonial metropoles.

name: La Collectionneuse
pitch: Sharing a villa for the summer, two male friends determine not to become the latest conquests of their beautiful, sensuous housemate, in this Rohmerian roundelay set on the sunny Riviera.

name: Cut-Off
pitch:
Cut-Off is an immersive 360° VR documentary experience that places the viewer in the middle of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's historic visit to Shoal Lake 40, a First Nation in Canada without access to clean water. Viewers also visit Cross Lake, where a state of emergency was declared after a wave of youth suicides.
WORLD PREMIERE
producers: VICE Canada, Occupied VR, National Film Board of Canada, Canadian Film Centre (CFC), TELUS Fund

name: CTRL
pitch: CTRL is a compelling of drama that combines VR technology with the emotional intensity of theatre. Viewers encounter Liam in the midst of playing a complex, strategic game. Something unexpected and shocking happens, and Liam must decide which opponents he really needs to overcome.

name: La Marquise d'O...
pitch: A young, widowed noblewoman finds herself inexplicably pregnant and is forced to consider an impromptu offer of marriage to save her reputation, in Rohmer's ravishingly realized adaptation of the famous 1808 novella by Heinreich von Kleist.

name: Troop Beverly Hills
pitch: A shopaholic Beverly Hills housewife (Shelley Long) determines to prove her community-service bona fides by taking charge of her daughter's Girl Scout troop.

name: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words
pitch: An energetic, sharply edited celebration of the famed American musician and composer, whose wackily charismatic public persona belied his complex artistry, fierce intelligence and political conviction.

name: Two English Girls
pitch: Based on a novel by Jules et Jim author Henri-Pierre Roché, this fatalistic chronicle of the love triangle between a pair of dissimilar English sisters (Kika Markham and Stacey Tendeter) and the Parisian art critic who loves them both (Jean-Pierre Léaud) is widely considered to be one of Truffaut's masterpieces.

name: Fatima, the Algerian Woman of Dakar
pitch: In the aftermath of the Algerian War, a young Algerian woman reaches a strange reconciliation with the Senegalese officer who raped and impregnated her.

name: Full Moon in Paris
pitch: The late Pascale Ogier plays one of Rohmer's most memorable heroines, in this nigh-perfect work about a want-it-all young woman torn between her conservative architect boyfriend and her hip diva nightlife and pied-à-terre in Paris.

name: All the World's a Screen: Shakespeare on Film
pitch: This new documentary from BBC Arena and Film London uses fascinating clips, archival interviews and behind-the-scenes footage to relate the century-plus history of celluloid Shakespeare.

name: Cosmos
pitch: Adapted from the classic novel by Witold Gombrowicz, Andrzej Zulawski's final film is a metaphysical screwball comedy about a young student investigating the absurd yet unsettling mystery of who has been hanging sparrows on the grounds of a country estate.

name: The Untouchables
pitch: Brian De Palma had one of his biggest critical and commercial hits with this handsome big-screen version of the 1950s TV series, about a straight-shooting federal agent (Kevin Costner) who recruits an unorthodox team to take down Chicago crime kingpin Al Capone (Robert De Niro).

name: Wiener-Dog
pitch: The new film from director Todd Solondz (Welcome to the Dollhouse, Happiness) is a dark, stark, and appallingly funny story of an itinerant dog and the many different people she touches over her short lifetime.
cast: Greta Gerwig, Kieran Culkin, Danny DeVito, Ellen Burstyn, Julie Delpy, Zosia Mamet

name: Casualties of War
pitch: Sean Penn and Michael J. Fox star in this devastating war drama based on the true story of a squad of American soldiers who raped and murdered a young Vietnamese woman during a mission in 1966.

name: Black Rain
pitch: A rule-breaking NYC cop (Michael Douglas) pursues an escaped yakuza through the neon-lit dystopia of Osaka, in Ridley Scott's cross-cultural crime thriller.

name: Sarraounia, an African Queen
pitch: Med Hondo transforms a little-known historical incident into an epic poem of African resistance to colonialism, in this story of an African ruler who rallies her people to repulse an incursion by a French military expedition.

name: Perceval le Gallois
pitch: Widely considered one of the director's greatest works, Rohmer's wondrous adaptation of the Arthurian legend sets the bumbling, innocent hero's quest for the Holy Grail against a background of outrageously stylized sets.

name: The Seventh Fire
pitch: Terrence Malick presents this haunting and visually arresting non-fiction film about the Native American gang crisis.
producers: Jack Pettibone Riccobono, Jihan Robinson, Joey Carey, Shane Slattery-quintanilla
editors: Andrew Ford, Adelaide Papazoglou, Michael J. Palmer

name: Video Game Design (Ages 11-14)
pitch: One of our most popular camps, Video Game Design Camp allows young gamers to engage with this field through hands on experience.

name: Le Rayon vert followed by En compagnie d'Éric Rohmer introduced by Marie Rivière
pitch: Marie Rivière introduces her starring turn in Rohmer's masterpiece, and her 2010 documentary about the director.

name: The Gold Rush
pitch: One of Charles Chaplin's greatest masterpieces finds the Tramp looking to strike it rich (in gold and love) as a prospector in the Klondike.

name: Confidentially Yours
pitch: A devoted secretary (Fanny Ardant) tries to clear her boss (Jean-Louis Trintignant) of a murder charge, in François Truffaut's lustrous homage to Hitchcock and American film noir.

name: Le Rayon vert
pitch: Rohmer's marvellously funny and movingly humane comedy chronicles a young woman's desperate search for a companion to share her summer vacation in the south of France.

name: Senza Peso
pitch: In Senza Peso you are a soul transitioning into the afterlife. The experience shepherds you on a spiritual journey through a beautifully dark world of lost souls and redemption. Based on a short film and mini-opera by Cory Strassburger and Alain Vasquez.

name: Amour fou
pitch: A lovely complement to Rohmer's adaptation of Heinrich von Kleist's La Marquise d'O…, Jessica Hausner's sublimely funny and immensely touching chronicle of the forlorn Kleist's final days and double suicide with his kindred spirit Henriette Vogel is one of the most beautiful films of this decade.
production: coop99 Filmproduktion, Amour Fou Film Luxembourg, Essential Film
producers: Martin Gschlacht, Antonin Svoboda, Bruno Wagner, Bady Minck, Alexander Dumreicher Ivanceanu, Philippe Bober
sound: Uwe Haußig, Michael Schillings, Nicolas Tran Trong
cast: Christian Friedel, Sandra Hüller, Birte Schnöink, Stephan Grossmann, Holger Handtke, Barbara Schnitzler, Alissa Wilms, Peter Jordan, Paraschiva Dragus, Katharina Schüttler, Gustav Peter Wöhler, Marie-Paul von Roesgen, Marc Bischoff

name: Shadow of a Doubt
pitch: A teenage girl discovers that her beloved uncle may be a serial killer, in Hitchcock's deliciously dark vision of small-town America.
cast: Teresa Wright, Joseph Cotten, Macdonald Carey

name: Born in Flames
pitch: Presented here in a brand new 35mm preservation print, Lizzie Borden's radical feminist masterpiece is as incendiary (and relevant) now as it was at the dawn of the Reaganite '80s.

name: Lost
pitch: In Lost, experience the wonder of an unexpected encounter in a magical forest. From the director of Pixar's The Blue Umbrella.

name: The Freshman
pitch: The great silent clown Harold Lloyd scored his biggest box-office hit with this classic campus comedy.

name: Lumière noire
pitch: An aircraft engineer's investigation into a police cover-up hinges on the eyewitness account of a young African deportee.

name: Phil Tippett’s OMG (Oculus MAD GOD)
pitch: OMG is an immersive virtual reality experience set in the stop-motion world of Phil Tippett’s auteur short series, MAD GOD. Visual effects and stop-motion artist Tippett has created a darkly surreal world in which the creatures and nightmares of his imagination roam free.

name: Little Men
pitch: Jake (Theo Taplitz) is a quiet, sensitive middle schooler with dreams of being an artist. He meets the affably brash Tony (Michael Barbieri) at his grandfather's funeral, and the unlikely pair soon hit it off. The budding friendship is put at risk, however, when a rent dispute between Jake's father, Brian (Greg Kinnear), and Tony's mother, Leonor (Paulina Garcia), threatens to become contentious.
cast: Greg Kinnear

name: Carlito's Way
pitch: A decade after Scarface, Brian De Palma and Al Pacino reunited for this considerably more tender-hearted take on the gangster genre, about a former Puerto Rican drug lord who finds himself being pulled back into his old life by his loyalty to his friends.

name: Gleason
pitch: This inspirational documentary follows former New Orleans Saints star defensive back Steve Gleason, whose diagnosis with ALS at age 34 sets him off on a mission to find his true purpose in life.

name: Our Little Sister
pitch: After their estranged father's death, three twentysomething sisters discover that they have a teenaged step-sibling, in this gentle, deeply affecting family drama from Japanese master Hirokazu Kore-eda (Like Father, Like Son).
cast: Haruka Ayase, Masami Nagasawa, Kaho , Suzu Hirose

name: Free Willy
pitch: A young boy befriends a captive orca at a marine park and determines to release him back into the ocean, in this hit family adventure.

name: Watani, a World Without Evil
pitch: Med Hondo contrasts the trajectories of two men — a laid-off white bank executive who sinks into Paris' racist, extreme right-wing netherworld, and an African immigrant who struggles to find employment after being fired from his job as a garbage collector — in this searing vision of xenophobia and homegrown fascism.

name: How Heavy This Hammer
pitch:
Intro and Q&A with director Kazik Randwanski on August 12 at 7:00pm!
Toronto director Kazik Radwanski follows his internationally acclaimed, award-winning debut Tower with this empathetic yet clear-eyed character study about a middle-aged married man who finds his only outlet in online gaming.
sound: Grant Edmonds, Gabe Knox, Cait MacIntosh
cast: Erwin Van Cotthem, Kate Ashley, Seth Kirsh, Andrew Latter

name: Saboteur
pitch: Accused of sabotaging the aircraft plant where he works, a wrongly accused engineer flees cross-country and uncovers a high-level Nazi spy ring working to undermine America, in Hitchcock's breathlessly exciting wartime thriller.

name: Purple Rain
pitch: The late musical icon Prince made his mark on movie screens with this smash-hit rock musical.

name: Singin' in the Rain
pitch: Gene Kelly, Debbie Reynolds and Donald O'Connor star in this classic musical set at the end of Hollywood’s silent era.

name: The Wild Child
pitch: Truffaut directs and co-stars in this fact-based story about the relationship between a compassionate doctor and a young boy found living naked, speechless and filthy in a French forest in the 18th century.

name: A Tale of Springtime
pitch: In the first of Rohmer's Tales of the Seasons, a teenaged pianist single-mindedly sets out to play matchmaker for her father by manoeuvring his current mistress out of the picture.

name: A Tale of Winter
pitch: A hairdresser sets out on a quest to find the lover who left her pregnant after a summer fling, in Rohmer's exquisite comedy of coincidence and kismet.

name: Polisario, a People in Arms
pitch: An on-the-ground documentary chronicle of the liberation war being fought by the people of the Western Sahara against the Moroccan occupiers.

name: Pauline at the Beach
pitch: Rohmer's greatest hit in North America is set at a Normandy resort in the summer, where a sextet of young lovers spends the last weeks of the season misunderstanding each other's desires and motives.

name: The Tree, the Mayor and the Mediatheque
pitch: A "progressive" mayor's plan to build a cultural centre in the middle of a small farming village sparks a clash between the forces of tradition and modernity, in Rohmer's topical, politically charged satire.

name: Mission: Impossible
pitch: De Palma was hand-picked by producer-star Tom Cruise to helm this blockbuster revamp of the classic 1960s spy series.

name: Truman
pitch: This delicate, intricate film from director Cesc Gay, in which a Madrid man puts his affairs in order during his final days, offers a humorous and honest portrait of courage and acceptance in the face of death.
production: Imposible Films, TRUMANFILM AIE, BD Cine
cast: Ricardo Darín, Javier Cámara

name: Unlocking the Cage
pitch: Animal rights lawyer Steven Wise fights for the legal personhood of four captive chimpanzees, in this affecting and thought-provoking documentary from Chris Hegedus and D.A. Pennebaker (Kings of Pastry, The War Room).

name: POP 03
pitch:
IN COLLABORATION WITH
 
Although they’ve been around a long time, virtual reality and immersive media have barely begun to be explored as mediums for art. Some incredible work has been created to date; at POP 03 we’ll show some of the best, and get into the conversation about what’s next. What are the possibilities for creating new worlds, warping people’s perceptions, and using technology to potentially change what we mean by “art” and “story”?
PRICE
$23.75 / $16 for TIFF members
Timed entry begins every two hours and lasts two hours. For ages 13+.
PRO TIP: You may not be able to experience every VR installation during the two-hour window, so if there's something you're eager to try, go there first!
 POPx
  Explore the POP03 installation from 6–8 PM, and then hear from VR creators, storytellers and filmmakers in a panel discussion starting at 8PM. Party with us—and the speakers—afterwards!
  Saturday August 20 6pm – 10pm
   PRICE$36 / $30 for TIFF members
   
  POPx (Speakers Only)
  Only looking to join us for the Speaker Session at 8pm (and the party afterwards)? This is the ticket for you.
Saturday August 20 8pm – 10pm
   PRICE$23.75 / $16 for TIFF members

name: Rendezvous in Paris
pitch: Rohmer stages three romantic encounters in the City of Light that add up to one grand statement about the vagaries of love.

name: Snake Eyes
pitch: A cheerfully corrupt cop (Nicolas Cage) uncovers a sinister conspiracy following a political assassination at a championship Atlantic City boxing match, in De Palma's flamboyant thriller.
cast: Nicolas Cage

name: The Music of Kurt Weill: September Songs preceded by Burnt Toast: The Argument
A Summer's Tale
pitch: During summer vacation, a self-absorbed young troubadour finds his romantic life suddenly in overdrive as three women compete for his attention, in the third of Rohmer's Tales of the Seasons.

name: The Birds
pitch: A small town is attacked by flocks of murderous birds in Alfred Hitchcock's chilling tale of ecological apocalypse.

name: Femme Fatale
pitch: A seductive jewel thief (Rebecca Romijn) ropes a bewildered photographer (Antonio Banderas) into a deadly game of double-, triple- and quadruple-crosses, in De Palma's delicious ode to classic film noir.

name: The Story of Adele H.
pitch: Isabelle Adjani became an international star playing the daughter of Victor Hugo, whose obsessive passion for a vain British lieutenant leads her on an increasingly humiliating, self-destructive journey from Guernsey to Canada and Barbados.

name: A Tale of Autumn
pitch: A middle-aged widow running a vineyard in the south of France becomes the unwitting target of competing matchmakers, in this splendid late vintage Rohmer.

name: Dial M for Murder
pitch: A retired tennis pro (Ray Milland) plans the "perfect" murder of his adulterous wife (Grace Kelly) in Alfred Hitchcock’s devilish drawing-room thriller.
cast: Grace Kelly, Robert Cummings

name: The Lady and the Duke
pitch: A fiercely royalist English noblewoman spars with her former lover, a pro-revolutionary French duke, in Rohmer's visually astonishing and immensely suspenseful story of the French Revolution.

name: The Black Dahlia
pitch: Two cops (Josh Hartnett and Aaron Eckhart) find their personal lives spiralling out of control as they investigate a gruesome murder in 1940s L.A., in De Palma's stylishly sordid adaptation of the James Ellroy novel.

name: Triple Agent
pitch: The wife of an exiled White Russian general becomes drawn into her husband's complex web of political intrigue in interwar Paris, in Rohmer's unconventional take on the spy thriller.

name: Mission to Mars
pitch: A rescue mission to the Red Planet unearths the key to a metaphysical mystery, in De Palma's critically lambasted but visually dazzling space adventure.

name: From Dusk Till Dawn
pitch: A mass-murdering desperado (George Clooney), a meek ex-priest (Harvey Keitel) and assorted other oddballs must fight for their lives when they become trapped in a hellhole Mexican biker bar staffed by ravenous vampires.

name: Step By Step followed by A Flood in Baath Country introduced by Kay Dickinson
pitch:
Scholar Kay Dickinson introduces Syrian cinema pioneer Ossama Mohammed's first short film, as well as his colleague Omar Amiralay's scathing documentary about the Baath regime.
Due to unforeseen circumstances, director Ossama Mohammed will not be able to join us for tonight's event. We apologize for the inconvenience.

name: The Sandlot
pitch: Set in 1960s southern California, this feel-good tribute to America's favourite pastime follows a ragtag pick-up baseball team whose sandlot playing field is threatened by the legendary and ferocious neighbourhood dog, "The Beast."

name: The Wrong Man
pitch: One of Alfred Hitchcock's most profound and moving films chronicles the real-life story of a New York club musician (Henry Fonda) who was arrested for a series of armed robberies he did not commit.

name: Redacted
pitch: De Palma's angriest, most overtly political film in years adopts a found-footage aesthetic for its lightly fictionalized account of a 2006 case of rape and mass murder by US soldiers in Iraq.

name: Documentary Spotlight
pitch: See the world through this eclectic collection of short documentaries.

name: The Romance of Astrée and Celadon
pitch: Rohmer's final film is an enchanting fantasy romance set in 5th-century Gaul, where a shepherd's split with his beautiful blonde fiancée leads to a series of Shakespearean twists and amorous misunderstandings.

name: Sacrifices
pitch:
The impending death of an autocratic patriarch throws a provincial family into disarray, in Ossama Mohammed's visually captivating cinematic fable.
Due to unforeseen circumstances, director Ossama Mohammed will not be able to join us for tonight's event. We apologize for the inconvenience.

name: To Catch a Thief
pitch: Cary Grant and Grace Kelly spark fireworks in Hitchcock's smoulderingly sexy comedy-thriller, in which an ex-thief living on the French Riviera is forced out of retirement when a copycat starts committing a series of robberies bearing his trademark.
cast: Grace Kelly, Cary Grant

name: Only Lovers Left Alive
pitch: Indie icon Jim Jarmusch creates a very different kind of vampire movie in this story of two nosferatic lovers (Tom Hiddleston and Tilda Swinton) who retreat from the ravaged modern world to the decrepit comforts of a crumbling Detroit mansion.
production: Pandora Film Produktion, Recorded Picture Company

name: The Lady Vanishes
pitch: Hitchcock's witty, crackling thriller is set on a trans-European express, where the mysterious disappearance of a kindly old governess leads a pair of amateur sleuths (Margaret Lockwood and Michael Redgrave) to uncover a sinister foreign plot to destroy the UK.

name: Return to Homs
pitch: Filmed over three years during the siege of Homs in the ongoing civil war, Talal Derki's visceral, close-up documentary chronicles how two committed pacifist insurgents against the Assad regime try to resist surrendering to the encroaching violence of the armed conflict.

name: The Green Room
pitch: Truffaut plays the lead in one of his most personal films, about a grieving WWI veteran who builds a strange private monument to the people he has lost.

name: Haunted
pitch: Filmmaker Liwaa Yazji weaves conversations with friends, family and internal refugees from the Syrian civil war into an eloquent meditation on the physical, emotional and psychological toll of displacement.

name: Silvered Water, Syria Self-Portrait
pitch: The astonishing collaboration between exiled Syrian filmmaker Ossama Mohammed and young Kurdish activist Wiam Simav Bedirxan distills footage from thousands of clandestine videos to create a shattering, on-the-ground documentary chronicle of the ordeal being undergone by ordinary Syrians in the ongoing civil war.
producers: Orwa Nyrabia, Serge Lalou, Camille Laemle, Diana El Jeiroudi

name: Stolen Kisses
pitch: Kicked out of the army, Truffaut's now 20-year-old alter ego Antoine Doinel (Jean-Pierre Léaud) embarks on a quest to find the perfect job and the perfect woman, in this delightful cinephilic comedy.

name: Marnie
pitch: Sean Connery and Tippi Hedren star in Alfred Hitchcock's twisted tale of sexual pathology and compulsive crime.

name: Passion
pitch: Rachel McAdams and Noomi Rapace star in De Palma's fiendishly clever mix of corporate satire and psychological thriller.
cast: Rachel McAdams, Noomi Rapace, Karoline Herfurth, Paul Anderson

name: The Extras
pitch: A multiple festival award-winner, the fourth feature from Syrian art-cinema pioneer Nabil el-Maleh is the engaging story of a poor young couple's courtship.

name: Vertigo
pitch: A former detective (James Stewart) develops a fatal obsession with an otherworldly blonde goddess (Kim Novak), in Alfred Hitchcock's masterpiece of erotic fixation.
cast: Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes, Tom Helmore, James Stewart

name: The Last Metro
pitch: Catherine Deneuve and Gérard Depardieu star in one of Truffaut's last and most commercially successful films, a romantic and suspenseful drama focusing on a Parisian theatre troupe during the Nazi occupation.
